pi.name: Can Yang Zhang, Ph.D.
pi.position: Associate Professor, IBHE(Institute of Biopharmaceutical and Health Engineering), SIGS(Shenzhen International Graduate School), Tsinghua University, China
editorialBoards: Editorial Advisory Board Member of Journal of Future Foods
pi.intro: In order to diagnose and treat many diseases such as cancer, inflammation and bacteria-induced infections, etc., drug delivery systems (DDSs) based on stimuli-responsive biomaterials with effective delivery strategy are attracted widely more and more attention and in-depth explored in recent years. DDSs epitomize multidisciplinary research including chemistry, material, biology, pharmacy and physics, which is central to innovation in modern bio-nano-technology. My research is focused on designing and generating multifunctional bioengineered stimuli-responsive biomaterials-based biomedical devices (nanomedicine) and strategies used to efficiently and effectively prevent and treat some diseases (e.g. cancer, sepsis, colorectal diseases) based on the understanding of molecular mechanism regulating the interactions between therapeutic nanoparticles and biological systems “in vivo”.
researchInterests: Design and synthesis of stimuli-responsive biomaterials library
Development of immune cell-mediated drug delivery system
Development of polycationic polymer-based therapeutics for antimicrobial resistance
Development of multifunctional oral delivery system for health engineering
Development of microneedle patch for transdermal drug delivery and skin health engineering
pi.detailedIntro: I am now working at Shenzhen International Graduate School at Tsinghua University as an Assistant Professor/Principal Investigator. I have gathered unique expertise combining chemistry and chemical engineering (Ph.D. at South China University of Technology, China, Prof. Lijuan Zhang and Prof. Yu Qian), pharmacy and gene therapy (visiting Ph.D. student at Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München, Germany, Prof. Ernst Wagner), pharmaceutical biology and biotechnology (Assistant Professor at National Center for Nanoscience and Technology, China), cell culture, animal model and immunology (Postdoctoral Associate/Research Associate at Washington State University, United States, Prof. Zhenjia Wang), bio-nano-technology and layer-by-layer technology (Postdoctoral Associate at Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology, Singapore/United States, Prof. Paula Hammond). I believe that there are many interesting ideas would be promoted based on my experience and passion (self motivation, organization and time management skills). I also have rich experience in writing proposal for external grants and publishing papers. I will try my best to establish the team and complete my research/teaching work. My goal is to develop efficient and effective nanomedicine, nano-food and strategy for the treatment of diseases.

members.name: Dr. Xiaopeng ZHANG PhD
members.researchText: Preparation of polymer microneedles and development of soluble insulin microneedles
members.description: I was born in Ningxia province and received my Ph.D. degree from Beijing University of Chemical Technology (BUCT) in December 2021. My Ph.D. study mainly focuses on the design, fabrication, and stability studies of polymer microneedles. Now, I'm working as a post-doctoral student in Tsinghua Shenzhen International Graduate School. My research interests include nanobiotechnology, controlled drug delivery and microneedle for beauty or treatment of diseases such as cancer and diabetes.

members.name: Dr. Zohaib Hafiz Muhammad PhD
tags: Editorial Board manager of Majestic Journal of American Chemical Society
members.researchText: Design and application of coordination polymers and MOFs in drug delivery, molecular recognition, nucleotide structures, biomedical systems, and computational studies.
members.description: I was born in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and received my Ph.D. degree from Beijing Institute of Technology, China in March 2025, and am now working as a postdoctoral fellow at Tsinghua Shenzhen International Graduate School. I am working on coordination polymers and their crystal growth and design, and their various applications: drug delivery systems, amino acid separation and recognition, chiral drug recognition, the water helix structure of nucleotide coordination polymers, and metal-organic frameworks. I am also working on anticancer activity, antibacterial and antimicrobial peptide drug delivery systems, as well as MD simulations and theoretical calculations.

members.name: Dr. Jin XIE PhD

members.description: I was born in Hezhou, Guangxi, and received my Ph.D. from the Université de Liège (Belgium) in March 2025. I am currently a postdoctoral researcher at Tsinghua Shenzhen International Graduate School. My research interests include the design of layer-by-layer (LbL) nanoparticles and targeted drug delivery for the treatment of cancer, inflammation, and acute infections.
